reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: Moldova is the poorest country in Europe. Rising inflation and high unemployment means that overhalf of the population live below the poverty line. Parents face a daily struggle to feed clothe andeducate their children and many find themselves with no opti on but to place them in an institution.As a result of this there are over 8000 children growing up in state-run institutions where thestandard of care often fails to meet their most basic needs. A recent report by UNICEF and theGovernment of Moldova showed that less than 2% of children living in institutions are actuallyorphans. The rest have families but poverty is keeping them apart. By providing emotional andpractical support to at-risk families we can ensure that they can remain together and are not for cedto send their children to a damaging institution.This project is of strategic importance because baby institutions feed the rest of the institutionalsystem. By preventing children entering the Chisinau and Tiraspol baby institutions and eventuallyclosin g these institutions Hope and Homes for Children will significantly reduce the number of childrenentering the institutional system and support our objective of eradicating institutionalisation in Moldovaand Transnistria.As these will be the first baby inst itutions to close in Moldova and Transnistria they will provide abest practice model to influence the closure of the remaining baby institutions in Moldova and ofsetting up the support services to prevent children entering institutions in the first place. This willhave a significant impact on the number of children entering the institutional system and supportthe Moldovan Government's national Transformation plan and our goal to eradicateinstitutionalisation in Moldova.
